title: Bridging the Gap between ROS~2 and Classical Real-Time Scheduling for Periodic Tasks
abstract: arXiv:2408.03696v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: The Robot Operating System 2 (ROS~2) is a widely used middleware that provides software libraries and tools for developing robotic systems. In these systems, tasks are scheduled by ROS~2 executors. Since the scheduling behavior of the default ROS~2 executor is inherently different from classical real-time scheduling theory, dedicated analyses or alternative executors, requiring substantial changes to ROS~2, have been required. In 2023, the events executor, which features an events queue and allows the possibility to make scheduling decisions immediately after a job completes, was introduced into ROS~2. In this paper, we show that, with only minor modifications of the events executor, a large body of research results from classical real-time scheduling theory becomes applicable.
